structure.unit: ARTICLE L. MIAMI-DADE COUNTY HISPANIC AFFAIRS ADVISORY BOARD

text.section: The Office of the Chairperson of the County Commission, County Attorney and Clerk of the Board shall provide appropriate support for the Hispanic Affairs Advisory Board. The Chairperson of the County Commission shall have the power to appoint, employ, remove and supervise such assistants, employees, and personnel as deemed necessary to provide appropriate support to the Hispanic Affairs Advisory Board, and such assistants, employees, and personnel, including an executive director, collectively herein referred to as the Office of Community Advocacy, shall serve at the will of the Chairperson of the County Commission.
